lead_paragraph: America's two oldest monthly magazines, Harper's and The Atlantic Monthly, often go head to head in reporting and criticism. Each reacted differently to the events of Sept. 11. The Atlantic Monthly was caught with an unfortunately timed issue on the newsstands when the terrorists struck. Its October cover, ''Peace Is Hell,'' detailed the struggles of the United States military in peacetime. But on Sept. 11, it was decided that the attacks were ''the defining event of our times,'' its editor, Michael Kelly, said.
abstract: Changes by America's two oldest monthly magazines, Harper's and The Atlantic Monthly, in attempt to respond to new focus on war and terrorism, noted; photo (S)
